entry.title: Re: Please Provide some information on Option "PMR" in th...
entry.content:
Try with the below options

SAP provides a way to bring a ‚ÄúDone‚Äù SFC back to work using a Special Operation:

  • Go to Operation Activity POD
  • Load the Special Operation and its resource
  • Manually enter the SFC number and press Enter (not Go)
  • Click Start to begin the special routing

This will reactivate the SFC and make it visible again in the POD work list. Details are explained in this SAP blog by @ManoelCosta      

If you want to return the SFC to its original routing, you can use the Change Production V2 service:

  • First, reactivate the SFC using the Special Operation method above
  • Then use the Change Production service to reassign the original routing and BOM
  • This works only if the SFC is in Active status

More details are available in this guide by @EmirOzgul

entry.title: Re: VAT Registration number is invalid in customer master
entry.content:
The error AR197 ‚Äì "VAT registration number is invalid" in SAP typically occurs when the VAT number format doesn't match the expected validation rules for the country code you've selected. In your case, you're trying to use a VAT number starting with "XI" for VAT category GB0, which is associated with Great Britain (GB).

"XI" is the VAT prefix for Northern Ireland, used post-Brexit for intra-EU trade. "GB" is used for the rest of the United Kingdom. SAP validates VAT numbers based on the country code and format rules maintained in configuration tables like OY17 and OY01.

In order to overcome from the issue, you can try with some below options

Option 1: Use Country Code "XI" Instead of "GB"

  • If you're entering a VAT number like XI756815889, make sure the country code in the customer/vendor master is set to XI, not GB.
  • In transaction OY17, ensure that Country "XI" is defined and VAT number format is set correctly (usually length 11, check rule 3).
  • In OY01, make sure country "XI" is active and properly configured.


Option 2: Adjust VAT Validation Settings

If you must use GB as the country code, go to the ‚ÄúFurther Checks‚Äù section in the customer/vendor master, uncheck the ‚ÄúCheck VAT Registration Number‚Äù flag under ‚ÄúOther Data‚Äù. This bypasses the format validation, allowing you to save the number.

Use this only if you're confident the VAT number is valid and accepted by tax authorities.

Refer to SAP Note 3005939 ‚Äì for official guidance on handling this error.

Regards

Experience insightful days in Sydney

Join us on September 3‚Äì4, 2025, for the Premium Engagements Forum ANZ ‚Äîan exclusive event tailored for IT directors and architects. Connect directly with SAP experts and peers to explore strategies that drive transformation success and align IT with evolving business goals. With focused sessions on enterprise architecture, clean core, AI, and more, this forum offers actionable insights to power your next strategic move. 

Please note that the 'RSVP' button within this post does not serve as a formal registration for the event. To officially register and for any further information, please reach out to the event organizer: kate.dunstan@sap.com

entry.title: Multiple source systems connectivity to DRC cloud?
entry.content:
Is SAP public cloud can also be added to existing DRC cloud which was used for Belgium country. please confirm if the same DRC cloud can be used for public cloud edition implementation?

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Multiple source systems connectivity to DRC cloud?
entry.content:
Hi all,

 

Please note, the same DRC tenant used for Belgium cannot be reused for India or any other country in the SAP Public Cloud.

Each country-specific implementation requires a separate configuration within DRC, and in most cases, a separate tenant is provisioned for each country.

Request SAP to provision a new DRC tenant or activate India-specific configuration in an existing global DRC tenant (if multi-country DRC is supported under your subscription).

 

Please refer the below link for more information India document and reporting compliance (DRC),

https://me.sap.com/processnavigator/SolS/EARL_SolS-013/2502/SolP/5XU?region=IN

 

Best regards,

Atanu

SAP Support - S/4HANA Cloud

entry.title: Purchase Info record , netprice is not getting Updated in S4HANA
entry.content:
Hi All,

I have created a Purchase Info Record for vendor A with a net price of 100 Euros. When I manually created a purchase order, the system correctly reflected the price of 100 Euros.

Subsequently, I updated the net price to 110 Euros and selected the "InfoUpdate" checkbox in the purchase order.

My question is:

Will the next purchase order automatically reflect the updated price of 110 Euros?

Will the system update the Purchase Info Record net price to 110 Euros OR only add a new entry in the Order History of the PIR?

Thank you in advance for your insights and please highlight the config which could impact this behavior.

entry.title: Re: Partial set-off of down payment against regular custo...
entry.content:
It‚Äôs about structuring your billing plan and managing the sequence of billing events to:

  • Prevent the system from automatically settling the full down payment against the entire invoice.
  • Ensure that only the intended portion of the down payment is applied to specific billing items.
  • Maintain flexibility in how much revenue is recognized and when.

Below are the approaches on how to control Invoice Timing

1) Split the Billing Plan into Phases

Instead of one large invoice:

  • Create multiple billing milestones (e.g., 30%, 50%, 20%)
  • Align each milestone with a specific project phase or deliverable

This allows you to apply down payments incrementally, rather than all at once.

2) Delay Final Billing Until Down Payment Is Settled

  • Post the down payment request first
  • Wait for the incoming payment to be posted and cleared
  • Then generate the final invoice, ensuring the system applies the correct settlement amount

This avoids the issue where the system sees the net amount as zero and blocks payment posting.

3) Use Preliminary Billing Documents (PBDs) Strategically

Generate a PBD to preview and adjust invoice line items. Although down payment lines aren‚Äôt editable, you can control when the PBD is finalized. This gives you a chance to sequence billing events properly

4) Avoid Automatic Settlement Triggers

Don‚Äôt let the system auto-generate billing documents immediately after revenue reassignment or milestone completion. Use manual review steps or workflow approvals to control when billing occurs

entry.title: Re: Purchase Info record , netprice is not getting Update...

Hello @AAkash1 

If you maintained the net price condition in the info record, the condition will not be updated by purchase orders. That is explained in the note 569885 - About Info Record Update indicator (EKPO-SPINF)

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: How to configure Auto PO creation for ARC/OA
entry.content:
Hi @pratik_soni6 

Thank you for confirming.

There is a high-level overview of how you can configure automatic PO creation for active ARC or OA and integrating it with Commerce Automation for ASN and invoicing:

First, set up master data e.g., material, vendor, source list, info records ensuring ‚ÄúAutomatic PO‚Äù flags are set.

Then go ahead and configure automatic PO creation via SPRO and schedule ME59N for converting Purchase Requisitions to POs.

After that, define and implement PO release strategies for approval workflows.

You will need to Integrate SAP S/4HANA with SAP Business Network Commerce Automation. Then do the following: Push released POs electronically to suppliers. Then ensure to enable suppliers to send ASN and invoices digitally through the Business Network. Then automate 3-way matching and invoice validation for efficient procure-to-pay.

My advise is to also leverage the network‚Äôs supplier portal and invoice status visibility to streamline your processes and reduce manual work.

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Replicate availability data from external HR system t...
entry.content:
The API 'API_MANAGE_WF_AVAILABILITY' can be used to maintain availability data for workforce from external HR systems to SAP S/4HANA Public cloud systems.

Please refer to the help portal and API hub for more information.

SAP Help Portal Documentation - Replicate Workforce Availability Data from External HR Systems.

SAP API Hub - Workforce Daily Availability.

entry.title: Re: Purchase Info record , netprice is not getting Update...
entry.content:
To answer your first question, Will the next purchase order reflect the updated price of 110 Euros? Yes, if the Purchase Info Record (PIR) was successfully updated, then:

  • the next manually created PO for the same vendor-material combination will default to the updated price of 110 Euros.
  • This assumes no other overriding conditions (e.g., contracts, source lists, or manual price entry).

To answer your second question, Does the system update the PIR net price or just add an entry to Order History?, below is the key distinction.

So, both happen:

The net price in the PIR is updated to 110 Euros
A new line in Order History is created to reflect the PO transaction

Some of the important points you need to take into consideration:-

  • The InfoUpdate checkbox only works if the PIR already exists. If no PIR exists, it won‚Äôt create one.
  • The update affects the standard PIR, not the plant-specific PIR, unless the PO is created for a specific plant.
  • If you‚Äôre using conditions or scales in the PIR, the update might behave differently‚Äîit could overwrite or append depending on config.

entry.title: Re: How to find the possible values for any IDOC segment...
entry.content:
Hello @dineshhome1361_7 

Possible values are defined by a data element assigned to a segment field. For instance segment E1EDKA1, field PARVW - go to WE31 and display the segment definition:

Double click on the data element field, i.e. EDI3035_A. That will display the data element definition:

Double click on the domain EDIF3035. That will display the domain definition and value range:

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Advanced Intercompany Stock Transfer (5HP) in SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition
entry.content:
This blog post takes an in-depth look at the advanced intercompany stock transfer - scope item 5HP (as opposed to the Classic Inter-Company Transfer - scope item 1P9 ). This blog offers a comprehensive setup guide, testing procedures, and more implementation details. You can transfer inventory between different legal entities within a corporate group. Within the group, if plants belong to different companies (i.e., have different company codes), inventory can be moved from one plant to another.  If you‚Äôre interested in this business process‚Äîor have questions‚Äîfeel free to leave a comment and discuss!

The features covered in this article are based on SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition 2508, please refer to the latest information for changes in subsequent versions.

Index

Advanced Intercompany Stock Transfer process overview

Business Process Configuration

Business Partner Master Data Configuration

Product Master Data Configuration

Issues worth discussion

 

Advanced Intercompany Stock Transfer process overview

Much of the configuration and master data builds on Intercompany Stock Transfer (1P9) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition ; This post will focus on highlighting only the new additions. It is suggested to get the 1P9 process running end-to-end first. Building on that foundation will make implementing 5HP much easier since these two scope items can co-exist while Intercompany Sale is another story I will address it later.  Advanced intercompany stock transfer process can be triggered by using a specific purchase order type (e.g. NBIC) that has been enabled for advanced intercompany stock transfer process.

The following process overview helps us understand it better while you have to replace company code 1010 with company code 1320, company code 1710 with company code 1310, plant 1010 with plant 1320, plant 1710 with 1311 in this blog.

Create Intercompany Stock Transfer Order

APP: Create Purchase Order - Advanced (ME21N)

A stock transport order is created for the receiving plant 1320 (Belong to company code 1320) in the item level.  Business Partner PL1311BP in the header represents supplying Plant 1311 (Belong to Company code 1310). The system then recognizes that you are creating a stock transport order when the supplier entered matches a plant in another company code. Then, in the background, the shipping information is determined based on master data and configuration settings.

What‚Äôs different from 1P9 are the order type NBIC and Confirmation Control Key 0004. Please remember to enter storage location or the following inbound delivery creation will encounter issues.

After clicking Save, purchase order 4500000634 created.

You will find this purchase order in APP: Monitor Value Chain after clicking Go

Business Process Tab shows the IC Sales Order has been created automatically.

You can also see the graphical display of the process flow

Create Replenishment Delivery for Stock Transfer Order

App My Purchase Orders - Due for Delivery (VL10B)

The replenishment delivery is created for the appropriate shipping point using the My Purchase Orders Due for Deliveryapp, where the stock transport order number can act as a selection criteria.

Open the app, enter a shipping point, and a due date (optional). The system selects stock transport orders due for delivery. The ship-to party is determined from the configuration: the receiving plant is assigned a business partner master record that represents the ship-to party. You can flag the orders that you want to work on and choose Background. The system then creates replenishment deliveries for these orders in the background.

A green light on indicating outbound delivery successfully created. Go to Monitor Value Chain APP, Outbound Delivery 80000287 has been created automatically.

Process Flow shown as below:

Post Goods Issue from Physical Stock to Stock in Transist of delivering Plant

App: Change Outbound Delivery (VL02N)

After Picking and PGI,  as shown in the following screenshot, Inbound delivery 180000089 have been created automatically. Material document 4900001339 (Mvt681) representing Good Issue for OD into SiT (GIOD) has been created. At this point, the goods have been posted from physical stock of delivering plant to valuated stock in transit of delivering plant which means the ownership remain in delivering plant 1311. Valuated Stock in Transit | SAP Help Portal

At the same time, material document representing ‚ÄòPost GI rom Issuing SiT(GIIV)‚Äô is with a status 'Scheduled' because the Planned Date from outbound delivery header‚Äòs 2025.08.07 00:00 UTC+8 (= 2025.08.06 16:00 UTC). However, you can also input the actual date manually in the Internal Transfer of Control Dates section. If the actual date is in the past, the material document is triggered immediately.  If actual date is in the future, step will be triggered whichever time is earlier between planned date and actual date.

In terms of Stock, after posting goods issue, the quantities of Valuated stock in transit increase by 1 (from 1 to 2). Scheduled for delivery decreased by 1 (from 4 to 3).

APP: Stock Overview (MMBE)

APP: Display Stock in Transit (MB5T)

Post GI from issuing SiT and Post GR to receiving SiT stock

The goods movements are solely controlled via the planned and actual transfer of control dates in the delivery header. Base on these date the Value Chain Monitoring Framework (VCM) will trigger the goods movements. These dates trigger the automatic creation of goods movement using the Valuated Stock in Transit (VSiT) feature. Transfer of Control of Goods | SAP Help Portal

On the date 2025.08.06 18:44 (after 16:00 UTC time), the step Post GI from Issuing SiT has been completed with material document 4900001340 (Mvt685) created. At the same time, step Post Goods Receipt to Receiving SiT (GRRV) was completed automatically too with material document 4900001341 (Mvt107) created. At this moment, these goods are in the control of the receiving company that receives the goods and are part of the valuated stock of the receiving company.

Post Stock Transfer into Receiving Plant Physical Stock

In this step, let‚Äôs confirms that all the materials have been put away in the correct quantities and post good receipts.

APP: Change Inbound Delivery (VL32N), please input Inbound delivery 180000089

VCM shows material document 5000000899 (Mvt109) representing step Post Stock Transfer into Physical Stock (GRID) in receiving plant is completed automatically. And no financial accounting document created.

Inter-Company Supplier invoice will be triggered by this GR automatically.

Create Intercompany Billing Document

Actually the billing document can be posted already when the control of the goods has been transfered from delivering plant to receiving plant in the step Post GI from issuing SiT and Post GR to receiving SiT stock as shown below:

APP: Create Billing document (F0798)

Select the OBD and click create billing document. Choose billing type Intercompany Invoice (IV2) and maintain billing date.

Intercompany Invoice will be created after click SAVE.

Business Process Configuration

Assign Tax Codes for the Transfer of Supplier Invoices

101330 Assign Tax Codes for the Transfer of Supplier Invoices

The purpose of this activity is to assign tax codes to transfer supplier invoice data with a SOAP service. In this activity, you assign tax rates and tax types as sent by your invoicing party to tax codes defined in the system

Enable Value Chain Monitoring for Purchase Orders

SSCUI 105633 Enable Value Chain Monitoring for Purchase Orders

Maintain Intercompany Condition Record

APP: Set Material Prices Sales on condition type PPR0 over Sold to Party CO1320BP

 

Business Partner Master Data Configuration

Please refer to the same section in Intercompany Stock Transfer (1P9) in SAP S/4HANA C... - SAP Community

 

Product Master Data Configuration

Please refer to the same section in Intercompany Stock Transfer (1P9) in SAP S/4HANA C... - SAP Community

 

Issues worth discussion

Issue 1:

Purchase Order pricing and Sales order Pricing are independent and need to be maintained respectively.

More:

My intercompany blogs:

Intercompany Stock Transfer (1P9) in SAP S/4HANA C... - SAP Community

Intercompany integration scenarios FAQ in Cloud ER... - SAP Community

Advanced Intercompany Sales MTO and Variant Configuration (7DM) in S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition

È´òÁ∫ßÂÖ¨Âè∏Èó¥Â∫ìÂ≠òËΩ¨ÂÇ® (5HP) SAP S4HANA Cloud Public Edition

ÂÖ¨Âè∏Èó¥Â∫ìÂ≠òËΩ¨ÂÇ® (1P9) SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

My In-depth session on comparing Classic and Advance intercompany scenarios 1P9 vs 5HP and 1HO vs 5D2 with finance effect ( In Chinese). Only registered customer and partner can view.

GCR - S/4HANA Customer Advisory Council(CAC) - Content/Resources/Â§ß‰∏≠ÂçéÂå∫Á∫ø‰∏äÂàÜ‰∫´/In-depth with S4HANA Cloud...

It would be appreciated if you could click the Kudos button on both the blog and the replies‚Äîit helps us gather feedback and improve how we create content.

entry.title: Re: MULTIPLE FG & COMMON SFG
entry.content:
The understanding here is SFG01 is produced as part of multiple FG production orders. You want to track how much of SFG01 was produced, regardless of which FG it was used in.

So with that, to build your Z-report, use these standard SAP tables:

Next, go to MSEG, filter by movement type 101, material SFG01, Plant and Posting date as required. This gives you the actual quantity produced for SFG01. If you want to trace which FG order consumed the SFG:

  • Use RESB to find dependent requirements for SFG01
  • Link RESB-AUFNR to AUFK-AUFNR to identify the FG production order

Your ABAP logic should:

  • Loop through MSEG for GR entries of SFG01
  • Optionally link to RESB to show which FG orders consumed it
  • Aggregate quantities by date, plant, FG reference, etc.

entry.title: Re: Purchase Info record , netprice is not getting Update...
entry.content:
@Dominik_Tylczynski 

When the InfoUpdate checkbox is selected during PO creation, here's what actually happens and what is updated:

  • Order price history (last PO price and PO number)
  • Vendor material number
  • Basic data like delivery time or purchasing group

What is not necessarily updated is that Net price and conditions ‚Äî unless the update is triggered from a quotation or contract, not just a PO.

Why it looks contradictory and confusion arises because:

The system does update the PIR when InfoUpdate is checked.
But it does not always update the net price from the PO unless specific conditions are met.

So to be clear on "‚ÄúThe system updates the PIR with the new price (110 Euros)‚Äù and also says: ‚ÄúThe net price in the PIR is updated to 110 Euros‚Äù, this is only true if the PIR update is triggered from a quotation or contract. If it's from a PO, the net price may not be updated, even though the PIR is technically modified.

entry.title: Re: Autosubmission of empty timesheets
entry.content:
Hi @ManonH 

To get untouched empty timesheets picked up, I would suggest you consider doing the following:

First, define a Time Sheet Submission Rule in Admin Center that explicitly includes timesheets with zero entries. This means building rule criteria that accept timesheets even when no time records exist.

Then assign the rule you created to a Time Recording Submission Configuration which is linked to your employees' Time Recording Profile an example will be one for Overtime recording.

Optionally, you can leverage the Time Recording Calendar feature to trigger submission on scheduled dates, which can help cover untouched timesheets.

You then need to confirm there are no pending approvals or errors blocking submission.

Finally, if your current rule includes ‚Äúno entries‚Äù conditions but still does not auto submit untouched timesheets, please verify the rule logic and its assignment to the profile and submission configuration.

 

Below are useful references that will help you with more detailed information:

  • 2738965 - Time Sheet Automatic Submission and Workflow Processing Behaviour (SAP KBA)
  • Automatic Submission of Time Sheets (SAP Help Portal)

 

I hope this provides the necessary information. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to upload data from excel to the database tables
entry.content:
Given your upgrade from SAP S/4HANA 1909 to 2023, and the need to restore data from Excel backups if any loss occurs, here's a recommended approach that balances business integrity and technical safety:

Direct updates to database tables bypass SAP‚Äôs application logic, risking:

  • Data inconsistency
  • Broken referential integrity
  • Audit and compliance issues

Below would be the Business Process considerations

From the Technical point of view, SAP provides several safe and supported ways to upload Excel data:

Most importantly, validate before Upload by comparing Excel backup with post-upgrade data, use ABAP logic to highlight missing records, Only upload delta records after approval

Again and again, the final advice is that even in upgrade scenarios, never update SAP tables directly via SQL or SE16N. Instead, use application-layer tools that respect SAP‚Äôs data model and business rules.

entry.title: Function Expression in Business Rule Framework (BRF+)
entry.content:
Function in BRF+:

A function is the rule interface in BRF+ and acts as a link between the application code and the BRF+ code. A function carries a context and a result. It imports the context from the calling application and passes the context data to the assigned top expression or ruleset for further processing.

Create an BRF+ application or chose the application in which you wanted to add function Expression. 

Right click on the application and select create > Function 

 

Provide the function name, text and short text.

Click on create and navigate to object to save and activate the object.  

 

Once clicked, it will navigate to the above screen. Here you have to assign the result data object based on the context data objects. 

Types of Mode: 

Function mode: 

In functional mode, function execution starts with the assigned top expression. From this top expression, the processing may run through any number of nested subexpressions until a result is returned.  

Event mode: 

In event mode, the function is associated with a list of rulesets that are executed according to their execution priority and their position in the list. 

Function and Event mode:

This mode is a combination of the modes mentioned above. At runtime, the function starts processing the assigned top expression. Once the expression evaluation is finished, function execution continues with the associated rulesets. 

Analytical Mode: 

It is mainly related to the Hana rules framework which is relevant to the runtime operations. 

 Signature

The function signature consists of two parts: 

  • Context 

The context is a container for data objects that you can assign as import parameters for the function. You choose the context data objects of a function according to the requirements of the calling application by which the BRF+ function is invoked. Also, the context data objects of a function define the scope of objects that can be accessed by the expressions that are evaluated during function execution. 

  • Result 

The result data object returns a result value that has been calculated by the expressions of which the function consists . 

Note: For further in event mode, the result object is automatically set to the predefined actions table where the actions are recorded that have been triggered by the assigned rulesets. 

Code Generation:

BRF+ provides a built-in code generation facility used to compile source code for as many rule constructs in a function as possible. With the help of generated code, BRF+ rules can be executed significantly faster than in interpretation mode. 

Simulation: 

You can simulate the function processing to test the function's behavior in a sandbox environment. Here, you can gain an in-depth insight into the system status for every single step the system takes during function processing. 

Trace

In BRF+, you can request the system to create a processing log to keep track of all processing steps during function execution. The trace information is stored in the system and can be reviewed at any point in time. 

Trace will be stored in Trace tables FDT_TRACE_*

Generation Services

For a BRF+ function, you can take advantage of different services that automatically generate code and other objects that are needed to bridge the gap between the ABAP backend system where a BRF+ function is hosted and other systems or environments that wish to access BRF+. The different services available address different usage scenarios. These can be categorized as follows: 

  • Code Templates 

A code template is a predefined snippet of ABAP code that you can use to call a BRF+ function from your application in the same system. 

  • Generate  
  • Function Module 

You can use a generated RFC-enabled function module to call a BRF+ function that resides in a remote backend system. This is useful in cases where you cannot bring BRF+ and the calling application into the same system ‚Äî be it for technical reasons (for example, different releases) or for organizational reasons (for example, missing authorization to develop in the remote system). 

  • Web Service 

You can use a generated web service to call a BRF+ function from a web application that is not ABAP-based, or that you can only integrate via its exposed services interface. From a technical point of view, web service generation is reusing the function module generation component of BRF+ and generates additional system objects needed for service enablement. 

Here we will work on Function mode example: 

 

Assign the top expression and in context add the required objects and finally assign result object suitable. 

Top Expression:  

Its is pre-condition of the function which will evaluate the number of nested expressions to find the result. 

To execute the function click on simulation. 

Click on continue 

Select the input true or false and click on execute 

Result : 

Note : All the objects created will be stored in FDT_* tables 

Conclusion: 

Function provides a built-in code generation facility used to compile source code for as many rule constructs in a function as possible
Function is the most important BRF+ object and it represents a decision service , which is the element that is in fact invoked by the application and the entire application is invoked by function to stimulate and provide the output we can invoke using the code generation to create report program for executing in GUI.
we can perform pre-conditional and event of action related condition's like rules for executing in the based on the specified rule using the type of modes in the function expression.

entry.title: Workflow condition for Purchase Order ‚Äì How to read Plant at creation time in Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hello Everyone.

I am working in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud and have created a custom workflow for Purchase Orders in Manage Workflows for Purchase Orders.
The workflow has 2 steps and should be triggered only if the Plant = 1000.

I am implementing the BAdI SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF to define and evaluate a custom start condition.
In the EVALUATE_CONDITION method, I can easily check the Plant for an already saved PO using i_purchaseorderitemapi01.
Example:

SELECT * FROM i_purchaseorderitemapi01 WHERE purchaseorder = @IS_sap_object_node_type-sont_key_part_1 INTO TABLE @LT_items.

Problem:
When the PO is being created for the first time (in draft mode),

  • is_sap_object_node_type-sont_key_part_1 is empty (no PO number yet).

  • There is no CDS view like i_purchaseorderitemapidraft to read the plant directly.

  • So I cannot determine the plant at creation time to set cv_is_true for triggering the workflow.

Question:

  • How can I get the Plant information for a PO at the time of creation (before it has a PO number) inside SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF in S/4HANA Public Cloud?

  • Is there a draft table or API available for reading the data?


I found some other custom logic where I am getting plant data, but there I have no changing parameter which evaluates Workflow triggering condition. 

I found below 2 business context BADI definition & Implementation feasible for Workflow triggering.

SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_DEF => Condition Definition
SWF_WORKFLOW_CONDITION_EVAL => Business Logic Validation
Except these I found no other feasible business context custom logic for workflow triggering.

How to achieve the above requirement
SAP S/4HANA Cloud ABAP Environment SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere Data Access Control Hierarchy with Dir...
entry.content:
Hi to everyone,

I had some troubles creating a DAC Hierarchy with directory which I posted here a few days ago. This solution might help you understanding the values for the permission table. Please let me know if there is better solution for creating a DAC Hierarchy with Directory. Thanks!

 

Goal of the DAC Hierarchy with Directory:

User X gets access only to the US Cost Center Shared Services.

Approach:

  1. Test your Hierarchy with Directory:

Make sure, the hierarchy with directory is working properly. The HwD has at least 4 artefacts. Controlling Area and Cost Center are the mapping fields for associating the DAC later on.

2. Preview in Analytic Model:

It is helpful to have a preview in the Analytic Model before inserting the values in the Permission Table. In the AM you can easily identify the objects you want the user getting access to. Choose the correct hierarchy at first:

Identify the cost center:

3. Permission Table:

3.1: Restriction

One or more 0 restrictions per user act as an AND condition

0 and 1 restrictions per user act as an OR condition

3.2: Target Node Type

The target object was identified in the AM as a leaf. The value "L" identifies the columns which are needed to map the DAC later on. 

3.3: Root Node Type

The target object L is under the node type N (here, N and R have the same columns). 

3.4: Root Values

Are the compound values of CostCEnterHierarchy (Column 1) and HierarchyNode (Colum 2). You have to insert the actual value of these columns. Note, that you have to add a backslash between the values: "0101/A000/A000\01710110"

3.5: Hierarchy Identifier

Identifies which hierarchy the target objects belong to (here: the cost center belongs to the first hierarchy)

  1. 0101/A000/A000
  2. F101/A000/CCH

4. Create the DAC:

Add the permission table in the Permission Entity.

The Identifier Column is the USER_ID defined in the permission table.

Mapp all columns to the Criteria and add the Hierarchy with Directory. 

Select the Node Type "L" as the target objects are leaf nodes:

5. Associate the DAC to the Fact view GL Account Line Item:

The defined user will have restricted access to the cost center:

 

Mapping:

6. Create AM:

 

Note:

In the Preview of the fact view, there is an error message "Duplicate key predicate". This won't be the case when you open the Preview of the AM.

 

The AM Preview shows the US Cost Center for Shared Services now:

entry.title: Re: Business partner transaction records restriction
entry.content:
@amer_alsharif wrote:

Dear,

how to restrict view a specific business partner id transaction records  in sap public 4hana,

I have business partner id and in manage/view supplier invoices all users can using this app but i want to restrict view all supplier invoices that related to this business partner id to be visible for a specific users.

thanks for your feedback.

Hello,

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, you can restrict the view of specific business partner transaction records by using the "Maintain Business Roles" app. You'll need to create or modify a business role to include restrictions based on business partner ID. This involves setting up a custom role with a specific "Write/Read" access filter for the relevant app (e.g., "Manage Supplier Invoices") and defining the business partner ID as a key restriction parameter. Assigning this new role to specific users will then limit their access to only the transactions associated with the designated business partner.

entry.title: Re: Behavior validation messages are not displayed
entry.content:
Hello Patrick

not sure if you found already a solution for the problem on your own. After some research and trial and error i found a solution on our release (S4HANA onPrem 2023).

To force the request for state messages from frontend, you have to add for the action (in your case Draft-Action PREPARE) that is initially triggered for the generation of messages a side effect which affects messages in the behavior definition. Here you then have various options to define e.g. the field or the entity that is used in a validation. So all of the fields or entities (or $self -> for the root entity) must not only be definied in the validation, but also in the side effect with an effect on messages, otherwise the messages were not shown in my case. 

If this not leads to success, also consider to adjust the CONSUMPTION BEHAVIOR DEFINITION with the extension of  

use side effects;

on top level.

i adjusted your initial version of the behavior with the corresponding side effect

 

managed implementation in class zbp_i_product unique;
strict ( 2 );
with draft;

define behavior for ZI_Product alias product
persistent table za_product
draft table zd_product
authorization master ( instance )
lock master
total etag LastChangedAt
etag master LastChangedAt
{
  create;
  update;
  delete;

  field ( mandatory ) ProductName;
  field ( readonly, numbering : managed ) ProductUuid;
  field ( readonly ) CreatedBy, CreatedAt, LastChangedBy, LastChangedAt;

  validation validateMandatoryFields on save { field ProductName create; }

  mapping for za_product
    {
      ProductUuid = product_uuid;
      ProductName = product_name;
      ProductType = product_type;
      CreatedBy = created_by;
      CreatedAt = created_at;
      LastChangedBy = last_changed_by;
      LastChangedAt = last_changed_at;
    }

  draft determine action Prepare
  {
    validation validateMandatoryFields;
  }
// The side effect forces the frontend to request the messages (SAP__messages) in OData call
  side effects
  {
    determine action Prepare executed on field ProductName affects messages;
  }
  draft action Edit;
  draft action Activate optimized;
  draft action Discard;
  draft action Resume;

}

entry.title: Re: IDOC/ALE best practise to Build IDOC_DATA(EDIDD) in ABAP
entry.content:
Thanks f√ºr all answers, for me as non nativ speaker it is difficult to write a question in the way people know what i mean.

I think the best design in a greenfield-appreach is to generate the ALF-Interface with Transaktion BDFG. In doing so you have another layer of seperation in filling a deep structure with dedicated data elements first and then generating the IDOC_DATA.

However my szenario is Brownfield so I build the IDOC_DATA line by line, however with more new abap-Syntax:

DATA: lt_idoc_data TYPE idoc_data.
    TRY.
        INSERT VALUE edidd( segnam  = 'Z1XXXXX'
                            sdata   = myobject->Z1XXXXX( ...) ) INTO TABLE lt_idoc_data.

        INSERT VALUE edidd( segnam  = 'Z1YYYYY'
                            sdata   = myobject->map_Z1YYYYY( ... ) ) INTO TABLE lt_idoc_data.

      CATCH zcx_mapping_exxor INTO DATA(lo_cx).
"Fill Bal Log(...)
endtry.

Mapping of the structures i delegate to a dedicated member-Object.

entry.title: ABAP Extensibility Guide ‚Äì Clean Core for SAP S/4HANA Cloud - August 2025 Update
entry.content:
End of 2022 we launched ABAP Cloud and published the new ABAP extensibility guide. This guide is the best starting point for overview of ABAP Cloud development model and ABAP-based extensibility options for SAP S/4HANA in the cloud and on-premise. The last update of the extensibility guide took place in May 2023 where we incorporated the feedback of early adaptors of ABAP Cloud in real SAP S/4HANA systems.

A key concept for extensibility in S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and on-premise outlined in the ABAP extensibility guide was the 3-tier extensibility model. This model described how ABAP Cloud and classic ABAP can co-exist within a single system: tier 1 contained ABAP Cloud on-stack extensions, as well as any developments with SAP Build on SAP BTP for side-by-side extensions. Tier 2 served to address gaps, providing mechanisms to mitigate necessary publicly released SAP APIs not yet available in tier 1. Finally, tier 3 encompassed classic ABAP extensions. Only tier 1 (and tier 2, when using recommended SAP objects) was considered as clean core. In contrast, tier 3 was classified as ‚Äúnot clean.‚Äù The ABAP test cockpit checks for ABAP Cloud readiness controlled the usage of classic ABAP in custom extensions.

The main objective of the clean core dimension Extensibility for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition and SAP S/4HANA on-premise deployments is decoupling of custom extensions from SAP standard via use of ABAP Cloud and reliable development and extension technologies to reach upgrade stability. On the way to clean core, dealing with the classic ABAP custom code represents a challenge for SAP customers and partners. Multiple customer and partner interactions showed that the binary classification of custom code in the 3-tier extensibility model in ‚Äúclean core‚Äù and ‚Äúnot clean core‚Äù and governance based on ABAP test cockpit checks for ABAP Cloud readiness were too restrictive and not applicable for systems with a lot of existing custom code developed with classic ABAP. Besides this there are also new custom extensions which need to be implemented with classic ABAP because for example the related SAP application area is not sufficiently covered by publicly released SAP APIs or is implemented with SAP GUI based technologies and frameworks. On the other hand, many of underlying SAP classic ABAP technologies, like ABAP List Viewer for example, incorporate an implementation stability which most likely will bring minimum upgrade risks and can be still utilized in classic ABAP developments.

The new Clean core extensibility white paper introduced by SAP incorporates evolution of the current 3-tier extensibility model with binary decisions on clean core to more detailed assessment of classic ABAP extensions based on the clean core level concept, allowing you as SAP customers and partners stepwise transformation to clean core at your own pace.

In a nutshell:

  • Level A are the cleanest custom extensions built either on-stack with ABAP Cloud development model or side-by-side using any option of SAP Build on SAP BTP ‚Äì ABAP Cloud, CAP or low-code/no-code tools

           Levels B-D relate to all classic ABAP developments and can be reached as follows:

  • Level B can be achieved by custom extensions that comply with SAP recommendations for the use of classic ABAP development technologies and the frameworks offered as classic SAP APIs
  • Level C contains custom extensions which cannot be qualified for Level B because of usage of arbitrary SAP internal objects. Under the condition that dedicated checks are performed before the release upgrade (following the changelog for SAP objects approach), these custom extensions can be considered conditionally clean.
  • Level D is not clean core and includes custom extensions with severe violations of SAP development recommendations like modifications, usage of not recommended SAP objects or extension technologies (e.g. implicit enhancements).

Following the new clean core extensibility guidance we have updated the ABAP extensibility guide with technical guidelines which are in line and support the clean core level concept for the classification of custom extensions.

Summary of technical ABAP extensibility guidelines for clean core


How the ABAP test cockpit (ATC) supports clean core level concept

Main updates for transformation of 3-tier extensibility model to clean core extensibility based on clean core level concept (see the activity log on page 1 of the ABAP extensibility guide for details):

  • Change technical guidelines for extensibility from 3-tier model to ABAP Cloud development and classic ABAP development
  • Explain classic SAP APIs and their matching to clean core levels
  • Provide ABAP test cockpit (ATC) recommendations for governance of classic ABAP development for clean core
  • Explain relation of custom code use cases to clean core levels
  • Describe changelog for SAP objects approach for assessment of upgrade stability of custom code using SAP internal objects
  • Change transformation options for existing custom code from 3-tier extensibility model to ABAP Cloud and classic ABAP developments

Supporting the clean core extensibility and clean core level concept with these technical guidelines for ABAP extensibility is a next significant step forward to support your clean core transformation at your own speed.

If you have already set up the 3-tier extensibility model and are following clean core development practices, you might be wondering if the new guidance changes everything. Good news ‚Äî you are already on the right track! The new clean core level concept simply provides enhanced guidance for everything you developed in tier 3 with classic ABAP.

If you now want to learn more about the refined clean core extensibility guidance and clean core levels, read the Clean core extensibility whitepaper.

For more information about ABAP Cloud and recommendations for classic ABAP developments, classic APIs, ABAP test cockpit setup and behavior for governance of clean core development supporting the clean core levels switch directly to the updated ABAP extensibility guide.

In addition, you can also use the updated ABAP Cloud - Extensibility slide deck . To get your questions answered use the ABAP Cloud FAQ and the ABAP Development community.

We will continue our ABAP Cloud and clean core collaboration with customers and partners and will share the new learnings and provide new updates. After this update related to the adaption of the new clean core extensibility model the next major update of the ABAP extensibility guide planned for Q4/2025 will focus on enhancements in ABAP custom code management tools and ABAP AI capabilities. Stay tuned!

entry.title: Re: MULTIPLE FG & COMMON SFG

If SFG01 is consumed by multiple FGs:

  • You‚Äôll find multiple RESB entries for the same MATNR = 'SFG01' but different AUFNR
  • You need to aggregate quantities per FG order, per date, per plant

entry.title: Is there anyway to cancel the VAT portion of an AP invoice which has been posted in error
Re: Public Cloud Payment medium file - Hash total calcula...
entry.content:
Hello @Sandhya_Reddy1 

In SAP S/4HANA Public cloud, you can‚Äôt use ABAP exits or BAdIs for payment mediums.
To add a hash total in a .txt file, you must:

  • Copy the payment medium format to Manage Payment Medium Formats.
  • Create an accumulator in the format tree to sum amounts or count items.
  • Map that accumulator to a footer/control record field.
  • Test via Manage Automatic Payments.

This is a standard-supported method in Public Cloud. 

SAP Help Portal ‚Äì Maintain Payment Medium Formats (S/4HANA Cloud)

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SSO Configuration Issue When Accessing S/4HANA Public...
entry.content:
Hi @Chris1973,

Thanks for your reply. I reviewed the configuration again, but the same error still occurs.
I confirmed that the trust configuration in SAP Cloud Identity Service includes both Build Work Zone and the S/4HANA Cloud system.
My understanding is that there‚Äôs no need to configure direct trust between Build Work Zone and S/4HANA Cloud; instead, each should be trusted with Cloud Identity Services. Is that correct?
For the trust setup between Build Work Zone and Cloud Identity Services, I used Open ID Connect, as it was officially recommended.
In the destination settings, I changed the authentication method for the destination N5T_Starter_rt_apps from "No Authentication" to "SAML Assertion".
I‚Äôm not very familiar with how to configure SAML Assertion, so I referred to the tutorial for N5T_Starter_rt_tiles and applied the same settings. Please let me know if any of the settings are incorrect or if any additional settings are required.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-build-work-zone-integrate-sap-s-4hana-public-cloud-content-to-sap/ba-p/13572886
